title: Here are the 62 companies that have hired nearly all of Wharton's class of 2019
text:
Wharton has a strong job placement rate (98.5%) for students looking for roles after graduation.

Two industries attracted students from the class of 2019 the most: finance (35.8% overall accepts) and consulting (25.1%).

Here are the 60-plus companies that hired two or more graduates from the class of 2019.

Click here for more BI Prime stories.

Wharton's MBA Careers Report was released this week, revealing exactly which companies hired at least two graduates from its most recent class.

The class of 2019 consisted of 863 students, according to the report. Wharton is known for its strong job placement, and this year was no exception. Nearly every graduate who was searching for a job now has one, for a 98.5% placement rate. The employers that contributed to this high percentage tackle everything from healthcare to legal services, although this year saw a higher than usual representation of venture capital job placements.

The two industries that attracted the class of 2019 the most were finance and consulting. This trend is mirrored in the following employers.
